item.title: Twilio Programmable Messaging Service Degraded for Outbound SMS
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Twilio Programmable Messaging Service Degradation Summary: Twilio Programmable Messaging service experienced a degradation for 7 minutes and 50 seconds, causing Outbound SMS status issues between 12:06:00 and 12:14:00 UTC on 2024-02-27.

Feb 27, 05:02 PST
Resolved - Twilio Programmable Messaging service was degraded for 7 minutes and 50 seconds between 12:06:00 and 12:14:00 UTC on 2024-02-27. During this period, customers may have experienced issue with Outbound SMS status being stuck in SENT status. The issue has now been resolved.

item.title: Unable to Activate New Programmable Wireless SIMs
item.content:encoded:
Feb 21, 07:23 PST
Resolved - All SIMs that were affected by this incident and could not be reactivated from status "deactivated" are now in status "active". Customers that issued a request to activate new SIMs may need to issue the request again since many of those requests were aborted after a day. The incident is now resolved, and the service is operating normally at this time

Feb 21, 05:19 PST
Update - We are continuing to see recovery, with SIMs successfully activating. We will continue to monitor to ensure full service recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 21, 03:19 PST
Update - We are continuing to see recovery, with SIMs successfully activating. We will continue to monitor to ensure full service recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 21, 02:50 PST
Monitoring - We have deployed a fix, and are beginning to see recovery, with SIMs successfully activating. We will continue to monitor to ensure full service recovery. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 21, 01:51 PST
Update - We are continuing to experience an issue in which Programmable Wireless SIMs in "new" status are unable to be activated. We have identified the issue and are working on a resolution. We will provide another update in 1 hour, or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 20, 17:56 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate the issue where Programmable Wireless SIMs in "new" status are unable to be activated. We are actively working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 20, 13:54 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate the issue where Programmable Wireless SIMs in "new" status are unable to be activated. We are actively working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 20, 11:54 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate the issue where Programmable Wireless SIMs in "new" status are unable to be activated. We are actively working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 20, 10:53 PST
Investigating - We are investigating an issue where Programmable Wireless SIMs in "new" status cannot be activated. We are actively working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 21, 07:00 PST

Feb 20, 07:36 PST

Feb 20, 07:03 PST
Monitoring - Our SMS and MMS incident monitoring services are now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 20, 06:44 PST
Identified - Our engineers have identified the issue causing our SMS and MMS incident monitoring services to be unavailable, and are working to deploy a fix. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 20, 06:30 PST
Investigating - Our engineers have detected a potential issue with our SMS and MMS incident monitoring services. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

item.title: Users Unable to Update Their CPS Value in Twilio Console
item.content:encoded:
Feb 20, 13:44 PST
Resolved - The issue where the users were unable to update their CPS on Twilio console has been resolved. We can confirm that Twilio console is operating normally at this time.

Feb 20, 13:12 PST
Monitoring - Our team confirmed that the issue with Twilio console is solved. Users should now be able to update their CPS. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 20, 12:41 PST
Update - We are investigating an issue with Twilio console where the users are unable to update their CPS. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 20, 12:24 PST
Investigating - We've become aware of a potential issue with users not able to update their CPS value in Console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
